info.title: InterServer myAdmin Host Management API
info.description:
**Introducing the InterServers myadmin Host Management API – Your Gateway to Seamless Service Management**

# Overview

InterServers is thrilled to present the myadmin Host Management API, a cutting-edge solution designed to simplify and streamline the management of our comprehensive range of services. Whether you're in need of [dedicated server hosting](), [web hosting](), [VPS hosting](), [backups](), [domain registrations](), [Mail Delivery services](), or our innovative hybrid VPS-bare metal product [Rapid Deploy Servers](), our API offers a user-friendly and efficient approach to managing your services.

With the myadmin Host Management API, you can now harness the power of modern [REST]() and [WebSocket]() interfaces to effortlessly maintain and control your InterServers services. Say goodbye to complex and time-consuming manual configurations – our API empowers you to execute a wide range of operations with simple, easy-to-use calls, ensuring that service management becomes a hassle-free experience.

One of the standout features of the myadmin Host Management API is its extensive language support. We have [code samples]() available in every modern programming language, allowing developers to quickly integrate our API into their existing systems. Whether you prefer [Python](), [JavaScript](), [Ruby](), [PHP](), or any other language, we have you covered. Our goal is to ensure that you can seamlessly integrate and automate your InterServers services, regardless of your preferred programming language.

To further enhance the user experience, we offer interactive [documentation]() that makes it a breeze to navigate and understand the myadmin Host Management API. Our comprehensive documentation provides detailed explanations, along with interactive code examples, giving you a hands-on approach to learning and implementing the API's functionalities. Whether you're a seasoned developer or just starting your journey, our user-friendly documentation will be your go-to resource for all your service management needs.

The myadmin Host Management API from InterServers revolutionizes the way you manage your dedicated server hosting, web hosting, VPS hosting, backups, domain registrations, Mail Delivery services, and Rapid Deploy Servers. It empowers you with a straightforward, intuitive interface, enabling you to perform complex tasks effortlessly. Take full control of your services with ease, thanks to our modern REST and WebSocket interfaces, and unlock a new level of efficiency and productivity.

Experience the power of the myadmin Host Management API today and enjoy seamless service management at your fingertips. Trust InterServers to deliver unparalleled convenience and reliability as we continue to pave the way for the future of hosting and datacenter solutions.

# Authentication

In order to use most of the API calls you must pass credentials from the [my.interserver.net](https://my.interserver.net/) site.  

We support several different authentication methods but the preferred method is to use the **API Key** which you can get from the [Account Security](https://my.interserver.net/account_security) page.

parameters.name: searchString
parameters.description: pass an optional search string for looking up inventory

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: number of records to skip for pagination

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: maximum number of records to return

sendMailByIdLink.description: The `id` value returned in the response can be used as the `id` parameter in `GET /mail/advsend`.
The `id` value returned in the response can be used as the `id` parameter in `GET /mail/advsend`.

get.summary: displays a list of mail service orders

post.description:
Sends an email through one of your mail orders.

*Note*: If you want to send to multiple recipients or use file attachments use the advsend (Advanced Send) call instead.

post.summary: Sends an Email with Advanced Options
post.description: Sends An email through one of your mail orders allowing additional options such as file attachments, cc, bcc, etc.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of your mail order this will be sent through.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: pass an optional search string for looking up inventory

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: number of records to skip for pagination

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: maximum number of records to return

get.description:
By passing in the appropriate options, you can search for
available inventory in the system

get.summary: Checks if the server is running

/login.summary: Log In to the system and create a session.
/login.description: Submit your login credentials to generate a session id which can be used for validating requests.

total.description: total number of mail log entries

skip.description: number of emails skipped in listing

to.description: The Contact whom is the primary recipient of this email.

from.description: The contact whom is the this email is from.

subject.description: The subject or title of the email

body.example: This is an email to inform you that something noteworthy happened.

subject.description: The subject or title of the email

body.example: The package you ordered on 2021-01-23 has been delivered. If the package is broken into many pieces, please blaim someone else.

from.description: The information to use for the From address in the email. from.

name.description: (optional) Name to use for the sending contact.

to.description: A list of destionation email addresses to send this to

name.description: (optional) Name to use for the destination contact.

replyto.description: (optional) A list of email addresses that specify where replies to the email should be sent instead of the _from_ address.

name.description: (optional) Name to use for the sending contact.

cc.description: (optional) A list of email addresses to carbon copy this message to.  They are listed on the email and anyone getting the email can see this full list of Contacts who received the email as well.

name.description: (optional) Name to use for the CC contact.

bcc.description: (optional) list of email addresses that should receive copies of the email.  They are hidden on the email and anyone gettitng the email would not see the other people getting the email in this list.

name.description: (optional) Name to use for the BCC contact.

attachments.description: (optional) File attachments to include in the email.  The file contents must be base64 encoded!

items.description: A File attachment for an email

filename.description: (optional) Filename to specify for the attachment.

data.description: Contents of the attached file (must be base64 encoded)

id.description: (optional)  ID of the Mail order within our system to use as the Mail Account.

BadInput.description: The specified resource was not found

AlreadyExists.description: The specified resource was not found

NotFound.description: The specified resource was not found

offsetParam.name: offset
offsetParam.description: Number of items to skip before returning the results.

limitParam.name: limit
limitParam.description: Maximum number of items to return.
